page.title: 17POPULATION OF CRANHAM
page.content:
Upminster and Cranham have a combined population of 26000.Nearly 90% live in owner occupied homes _ well over the national average.
About 16% of households are all pensioner; over 75% are 2,3 or 4 person households and only 6_8% are occupied by 5 or more people. Less than 1% of homes lack or have to share a bathroom or inside w.c.
Upminster has a top heavy age structure with 40% of the population aged 45 or more and only 21% in the 0_15 age group.As a consequence the population is expected to fall slightly in the 1990s.
Nearly 80% of households own at least one car and many own 2 or 3. Unemployment is only 4_5%.
